intro: Ilysanthes stictantha, commonly known as the red-stemmed bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, floating leaves and specialized bladder-like structures used for capturing small aquatic organisms. The plant thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater habitats, often found in ponds and ditches. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, typically greenish-yellow in color. Ilysanthes stictantha plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by contributing to the food web and providing habitat for microorganisms.
